author: FE Online
title: Horrifying news from Thrissur in Kerala! Suspicious husband hacks wife to death 19 times, surrenders to police
text:
Horrifying news from Thrissur in Kerala! Suspicious husband hacks wife to death 19 times, surrenders to police Horrifying news from Thrissur in Kerala! Suspicious husband hacks wife to death 19 times, surrenders to police After committing the crime, he surrendered to the police. By: FE Online | Published: February 21, 2017 12:06 PM In Kunnamkulam, a man named Pradeep has reportedly hacked his wife Nisha to death.(Representative image: IE) 
Brace yourself to read about a horrifying incident that the residents of Thrissur in Kerala woke up to this morning. In Kunnamkulam, a man named Pradeep has reportedly hacked his wife Nisha to death. After committing the crime, he surrendered to the police. According to local news reports, the reason for this crime is that he had doubts about his wife! In the last few years, the number of crimes against women and children in Kerala seem to be increasing on a daily basis. A recent crime that had also shaken the state was the abduction of a popular Malayalam actress who was threatened by members of a quotation gang that she would be injected with drugs and taken to a flat nearby. 
According to data, there have been 910 rape cases reported in the state in the first six months of 2016. Further, the total number of crimes against women have risen to 7909 till July the same year, out of which there were 78 cases of kidnapping women and 2332 molestation cases. Terming the situation as a ”complete breakdown of law and order in a state that is run by mafia gangs and criminals”, Union Minister Maneka Gandhi had called for imposing President’s rule in Kerala.
